meanings.definition: The act of making something conform to established customs or practices.
meanings.sent1: The conventionalization of the school dress code helped maintain order.
meanings.sent2: The conventionalization of handshakes as a greeting is common in many cultures.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the unconventionalization of wearing pajamas as formal attire raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her unconventionalization of traditional painting techniques created a stir in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The conventionalization of recycling has become crucial for environmental sustainability.

meanings.definition: The process of turning something into a convention.
meanings.sent1: Through gradual conventionalization, the new practice became widely accepted.
meanings.sent2: The conventionalization of online shopping has revolutionized the retail industry.
meanings.sent3: The unconventionalization of using chopsticks for eating soup led to some messy situations.
meanings.sent4: His unconventionalization of storytelling transformed the way narratives were perceived.
meanings.sent5: The conventionalization of social media has changed the way we communicate with each other.

meanings.definition: The state of being made conventional.
meanings.sent1: The conventionalization of the language made it easier for foreigners to learn.
meanings.sent2: In the conventionalization of marriage ceremonies, certain rituals are always included.
meanings.sent3: The unconventionalization of wearing socks with sandals became a fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: Her unconventionalization of interior design challenged traditional concepts of beauty.
meanings.sent5: The conventionalization of technology has transformed the way we live our daily lives.
